oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Captain Archibald D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA to his father
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Capt. Archibald D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA was from Wilson Co., Tenn. This letter discusses being encamped at the resorts of Warm Springs, Virginia. He discusses marching in heavy rains, "Most of us were without oil cloths and with our; guns haversacks cartridge and cap boxes canteens and last an greatest our knapsacks we had to trudge along on foot as best we could. Very soon every fibre of our clothing was saturated with water". He anticipates a fight with McClellan within a week.
